title: Frequency and period - blocks m1 m2 and 4 curves

content.question: Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> is on a horizontal surface and is attached to one end of a spring. The other end of the spring is fixed in place. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is displaced to the right of its equilibrium position, released from rest, and then oscillates with negligible friction on the horizontal surface. The resulting graph of the block’s displacement as a function of time is shown in the figure. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is then replaced with Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="m sub 2 is greater than m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is displaced the same amount to the right of equilibrium that Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> was, released from rest, and oscillates with negligible friction on the horizontal surface. Which of the choices shows a solid curve for the displacement graph of Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>? The displacement graph of Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> is shown as a dotted curve for reference.

choices.label: The figure is titled “Block 2” and shows the graph of a sinusoidal wave in the first and fourth quadrants of a gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time After Release,” and the values 0, 0.5 T sub 0, and T sub 0 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Displacement,” and the value 0 is indicated where the two axes intersect. The wave begins on the vertical axis 2 units above the origin, and it moves downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 0.25 T sub 0, and then reaches a trough at the coordinates 0.5 T sub 0 comma negative 2 units. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 0.75 T sub 0, and reaches a crest at the coordinates T sub 0 comma 2 units. The curve then moves downward and to the right and ends on the horizontal axis at 1.25 T sub 0.

The figure is titled “Block 2” and shows the graphs of 2 sinusoidal waves in the first and fourth quadrants of a gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time After Release,” and the values 0, 0.5 T sub 0, and T sub 0 are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Displacement,” and the value 0 is indicated where the two axes intersect. The dashed wave begins on the vertical axis 2 units above the origin, and it moves downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 0.25 T sub 0, and then reaches a trough at the coordinates 0.5 T sub 0 comma negative 2 units. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 0.75 T sub 0, and reaches a crest at the coordinates T sub 0 comma 2 units. The curve then moves downward and to the right and ends on the horizontal axis at 1.25 T sub 0. The solid wave begins on the vertical axis 2 units above the origin, and it moves downward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at 0.3 T sub 0, and then reaches a trough at the approximate coordinates 0.6 T sub 0 comma negative 2 units. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crosses the horizontal axis at approximately 0.95 T sub 0, and ends at a crest at the coordinates 1.25 T sub 0 comma 2 units.

The figure is titled “Block 2” and shows the graphs of 2 sinusoidal waves in the first and fourth quadrants of a gridded plane.
